column1: full and straight, neatly tucked off the pads backward of square
a low full toss outside off, 141kph, square drives and finds cover
well bowled! Hits a good length outside off, this one angles across the right hander and beats the drive
a wider delivery, he flays at it away from the body and doesn't make contact
short of a length at off stump, gets over the top of it and angles down to third man

gone first ball! Gets a big leading edge into the off side, loops high towards point for a simple catch. Tried to close the face, was early on the stroke but it looked a poor option in the first place as the ball was full outside off
good length outside off, some swing in, pushed to midwicket
plays and misses outside off as he aims to drive on the up, this shaped away
back of a length at off stump, worked to the on side
all the way! That gets the Sri Lanka fans going. Short of a length, Mendis gets inside the line helps it round the corner with almost a front-foot hook over fine leg
good response from Richardson, short of a length outside off, climbs over the top edge
back of a length outside off, Mendis stays a touch leg side of it and angles down to third man

huge shout for lbw as this swings back in and beats Mendis' flick to the leg side...given not out and Finch calls the review. Big question is did this pitch in line? Reasonably full length, nice shape from Starc. Well, well...third umpire says no ball-tracking available. This is interesting. Do Australia keep their review? Yes, it appears they do as it was a tech failure
angled in the pads, flicked strongly to long leg
flung down the leg side again, Starc has just lost his line in the last two deliveries
back on the stumps, Perera gets a little squared up as he defends
beats him with a full one outside that brings a drive, nice shape away from the left hander
seeing both sides of Starc this over, slips into the pads again and deflects wide of the diving Carey
tapped into the on side
over the wicket, back of a length, dropped to the off side for a sharp single and Mendis ends up sliding into the stumps. It's chaos out there!
short of a length at off stump, takes his bottom hand off the bat and runs it down to third man
short on leg stump, mistimes his pull and it loops towards square leg
fuller, at off stump, Mendis deep in his crease and drops his bat down on it
on off stump, 139kph, stays back to quite a full length, opens the face to third man
a big top edge sails over third man, which is the opposite side of the ground he was aiming for when he went for the pull against a short-of-a-length delivery
pushed into the covers off the back foot
a slower ball, full on middle and leg, tucked off the pads to square leg
dropped, but a very tough one! Short, hammers the pull towards Turner at midwicket...off the toe end, and it just reached him

picks out the man at deep square! Couldn't have found him any better. A short ball from Richardson, Mendis strikes it nicely but straight down McDermott's throat. Mendis is furious. Richardson has his first wicket of the series
back of a length outside off, neatly behind the line and punches into the covers...then there's nearly another mix-up in the running!
short of a length outside off, played into the covers
back of a length, straight, played to midwicket
that's a nice piece of timing through the covers off the back foot
angled into the pads, short of a length, can't get it past midwicket
at middle and off, keeps it back of a length, defended down the pitch
a touch shorter on off stump, plays a swivel-pull to deep midwicket
another top edge! This time over the keeper. You can see the sand burst up as the ball lands, but it still trickles into the rope
round the wicket, driven to deep cover off the back foot
round the wicket to the left hander, short on the pads but Perera pulls to the man just behind square
short outside off, cracked to deep cover
short again, outside off, better placement this time as he angles it wide of backward point to give the sweeper some work
angled into the pads, worked through midwicket
gets inside the line and nudges off the pads into midwicket, Agar chases it himself as the Sri Lanka batsmen just walk the single
over the wicket, touch short outside off but it's cut straight to backward point
brings out the reverse sweep, full at off stump, doesn't connect and it loops to short third man
full at middle, flicked to deep midwicket
touch slower, tossed up very full at off stump, driven to deep cover
keeps it full, whipped off the toes deep into the leg side but singles won't hurt Australia
a bottom-handed flick to the leg side from a full, straight delivery
full at the stumps, plays forward and gets an inside edge to the leg side...another gentle single
short of a length, worked off the pads into the leg side and there's better hustle this time to make the second
tucked into midwicket
angled into the pads, pushed through midwicket to the sweeper
nicely placed off the back foot as he cuts a slightly short delivery through backward point
on leg stump, turned off the pads to square leg
nudged through the leg side again, Agar makes good ground to prevent the second
full at the stumps, chipped in the air down the on side as the bottom hand takes over
goes back to a good length ball, square drives to deep cover
very full outside off, drives firmly to deep cover
a googly outside off, driven to deep point
comes forward and eases this out to the cover sweeper...just singles milked off that over
short of a length and just outside off, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
dropped short at a leg stump line. Pulled out to deep square
length and turning away just outside off. Pushed to point off the front foot
short of a length and in at middle stump, backs away to cut to sweeper
tossed up at a length on leg stump. Steps out and is beaten in flight as he looks to sweep hurriedly. Cops it on the front pad
misfield at long-off. Length ball just outside off, slapped on the rise to Smith's left and he over runs it and sticks out a right hand to get something on this
short of a length at the stumps, backs away and cuts straight to point
slower short ball, slammed in at an off stump line. Creates room by walking into the leg side and looks to pull this. Can only slice to midwicket's left
top edge falls safely in the square leg region. Bouncer gets steep as he looks to hook and takes his eyes off the ball. Was looking to check that shot or even evade by the time it got up in his face
short of a length and rising into the body. Mistimed pull towards deep midwicket
short and just outside off, pulled into the turf towards deep square

chipped straight to deep backward square! Short of a length and cramping him up at the hips again. He stays on the front foot and looks to use the angle and pace to launch this behind square. But that's taken well inside
just clears extra cover. Slower ball at a length outside off. Leans in and jabs with hard hands and has no control of it in the end
length on leg stump, onto his toes as he clips to deep square
short and in at the ribs. Gets on top of this and drops it behind square with soft hands

spanked past extra cover! Starc goes full and Sri Lanka have been starved of that length all series. An attempted slower ball. Ends up right in his slot with a lot of width and powers this to the boundary

dropped at point! Another full slower ball outside off. Looks to drive and gets a leading edge to point where Kane Richardson is seemingly also deceived by a slower ball - too eager as this floats right into his lap and he has a grab late and puts it down
short in the corridor, looks for the upper cut and just manages to clear the infield in the covers
sliced over third man as he swivels quickly for the reverse sweep. It's short of a length and pushed across him and he was quickly in position
that's fifty! He's making use after getting in. This length ball on leg stump is tucked into the midwicket region with soft hands and he's back for the second
full on leg stump, flicked to long-on with the turn
short of a length and sliding into the corridor. Tapped to deep midwicket off the back foot
full on middle stump, drilled powerfully to long-on's right where Smith picks up and keeps it to one
outside edge runs away from short third man. Length ball just outside off, looks to drive inside-out and gets a thick edge
short of a length and just outside off, makes room and swats it down to long-on

guided straight to the keeper it seems. But he reviews after being given caught behind. Short of a length and climbing up outside off. He looks to run it down to third man as it angles back into him off the pitch. There is a tiny spike as the ball passes outside edge. Sri Lanka will lose the batsman and the review. It's a faint edge, he probably didn't feel it. But that's a fair decision and he's gone
past the edge. Length ball pushed across the corridor. Hangs the bat out at it and can't make connection

short of a length at the hips. Shovels this to deep square's right and McDermott completely fluffs the throw and has Warner ducking for cover at midwicket as it trickles harmlessly towards the middle of the pitch
sjhort of a length and spanked on the rise to sweeper's left. Looks like Starc there who runs a long way and flings this back in inches from the boundary to save one
length ball just outside off, backs away and looks to scythe it. Comes off the inside half and ends up at mid-off
length on leg stump, flicked to deep mdiwicket
appeal for lbw as he's caught on the front leg trying to sweep. Agar is around the wicket, that probably pitched outside leg
length on leg stump, flicked into the leg side on the front foot
length on leg stump, tapped to long-on
length on leg stump, flicked to short fine on the front foot
length on leg stump, steps out and expertly drops this into the vacant midwicket region with soft hands

taken at extra cover. Finally manages to find that fielder after many close shaves. Short of a length at off. Backs into the leg side and pulls. Slices it right up for the fielder, he barely has to move
length ball slanted across the corridor, left alone
short of a length and jumping up at him as he gets behind the line of this. Defended to point in the end
short of a length slower ball just outside off. Steers it to point's right with soft hands
short of a length and just outside off. Defended to point
length and just outside off. Defended to point
length on leg stump, nudged to short fine's right with soft hands
full on off stump, driven to extra cover where Warner fumbles to allow a run
full on off stump, to the pitch and slams it to long-off's left along the floor. Slides and saves neatly, does Cummins
length and just outside off, pushed to midwicket off the back foot

length ball pushed across off stump. Looks to chop that and is beaten. Carey has the bails off meanwhile as the batsman tries to maintain balance on the back foot. The foot rises - Carey waits for it to rise - but is on the floor as he takes the bails off. Not out
length on middle stump, pushed towards long-on with soft hands. His direct hit deflects into the covers where they'll find an extra run
slower length ball on off stump. Leans in and tucks this behind square with a closed face
launched over deep backward square! Overpitched and on the pads. At his pace, the batsman need only get connection on the whip. And he does
using the pace again. Poor lines from Starc. This one is short of a length and into the hips. Once again, he stays inside the line and has a whip at it. To fine leg's left at great speed
slower length ball on off stump, opens the face and taps this to sweeper's right. Slides to complete the second
full and just outside off, mistimed drive along the floor to long-off

loses leg stump. Full ball headed into leg stump, the same kind that was lifted for a six earlier. Jayasuriya though has looked for a reverse ramp, while standing on his feet. No way he's going to pull that off from there
full slower ball on off stump, makes some room and clubs this to sweeper cover
smokes it over long-on! Wow! Richardson looks for the slower ball but drops it short. It sits nicely up at off stump and Malinga just lines up beside it and flat-bats it
full at the stumps. Makes room and drives to extra cover's right
slower short ball into the body. Looks for the slog but cops that on the body
slower length ball following him down leg side. He's behind the line and swinging at this but he can't connect
full at middle and leg. Looks to drive and gets a thick inside edge onto boot
nice start, full at middle, pushed firmly to mid-on
back of a length, straight, worked to midwicket
a slower ball on a good length, tucked into midwicket
full at off stump, hint of swing, pushed firmly to the off side
touch straighter, allows Warner to work this off the pads backward of square and immediate contrast in the tempo between the wickets
finishes with another slower ball at 112, Warner waits and then pushes towards point. Tidy opening over

big appeal first ball! Nips back from a good length, takes Finch on the back leg...a familiar-style of issue for Finch. Caught on the crease with the ball coming back and the review has been called. It has struck him quite high, above the roll on his back leg and he's on his toes. Do we have the tracker this time? Yes we do, and it's umpire's call on hitting
full at the stumps, not much footwork from Warner as he drives firmly to mid-off

what a beauty! At 148kph as well...a ripper from Kumara, back of a length at middle and leg, completely squares up Warner and beats him, clipping the back leg through the keeper who can't take it cleanly. Good job there was no edge
bang! Strong response from Warner as he rocks back to a short ball and hammers a pull well in front of square. This is good stuff
fuller, back of a length, on middle and leg at 144kph, Warner taps towards mid-on and scampers
over mid-on! Full at off stump, Finch swings through the line and sends it handsomely down the ground. In the end the over goes for 11
played into the on side
a man in form! Full outside off, Warner goes down on his back knee and flays a cover drive
full, 134kph, worked off the stumps to mid-on
that's a cracker from Malinga this time, a slower cutter that grips and bounces from back of a length, jumps past the outside edge
length ball just outside off, pushed to the covers
another slower ball, 116kph, shoveled off the stumps wide of mid-on to keep the strike
tight single as this bobbles out to the off side...111kph slower ball to start with, takes the pad
back of a length at off stump, defended to cover
back of a length outside off, Finch nicely into position and drives square through the covers. Hauled in just before the rope as three fielders chase it

dropped at mid-off! A flying effort from Malinga, who flung himself to his right and had the ball, but it burst out as he hit the ground. Warner driving on the up with immense power. Not sure that was quite as tough as Malinga made out
pulls a pretty full delivery, gets a bottom edge towards short fine leg
full, a slower ball, punched to mid-on where it isn't stopped cleanly
full at leg stump, slower ball at 104kph, driven towards mid-on who is deep enough for the single
full and straight, 141kph, can't beat mid-on as he drives
full ball outside off, throws his hands through a square drive, places it between cover and backward point
dropped at cover this time! Another shot with power, Finch driving a full delivery, and Oshada Fernando can't hold on to his right
gives himself some room and eases a slower ball into the covers
a strangled appeal for lbw as Finch aims to work away a straight delivery
moves well outside leg and then drives a low full toss, almost a yorker, straight to cover
big appeal lbw as Warner looks to work away a full slower ball, think there was bat involved...yep, big edge
another huge appeal for lbw, this time it's Finch missing a swinging yorker but it's sliding down the leg side
short down the leg side, swing and a miss
short of a length, helped backward of square with a pull
low full toss outside off, driven into the covers
driven off the back foot to cover
round the wicket, backs away and cuts square to the off side
round the wicket, stand and deliver from Finch as he hoicks this over wide midwicket
short on off stump, cut to deep cover
very round-arm action, on the pads, worked to square leg
tucked off the pads to short fine leg
short and pushed into the pads, not a great ball, but it's just a single as it trickles to short fine leg off a bottom-edged pull/sweep
starts with a very short one, Warner rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
full, he uses his feet and drives to long-off
touch too short outside off, square drives to deep cover
dabs this to short third man, more good running
stays in the crease and muscles this to long-on with a short-arm pull
steps back and pushes into the covers
what a stroke! That's a cracker from Finch. A full ball on off stump, it's a perfect lofted off-drive through the line over the rope
a bouncer angled down the leg side, it's sharp at 143kph but called wide
142kph, back of a length, tucked to midwicket
back of a length outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
that's a very short bouncer, left alone and it's another wide
flashed down to third man off the outside edge
taken at long-on! Finch trying to clear long-on again. It was a full slower ball, 105kph, and Finch couldn't quite get the distance
what a stroke to start with! A short delivery, Smith moves across the crease to get inside the line and whips it off his hip wide of long leg. Brilliant
full outside off, Warner's down the pitch and has to reach for it a little but drives safely wide of long-off
that's delightful! He's been in two balls and played two awesome shots. This is a simple skip down the pitch and a lofted drive straight of long-off
goes back in the crease to a short delivery, worked to deep midwicket
full, wider outside off, driven to cover
whipped off the stumps through the leg side
swung down the ground to long-off
legcutter at a length on leg stump, swiped down to fine leg
full and curving away just outside off. Shuffles and looks to drive, but gets this off the leading edge as the bat face closes. Rajapaksa with a diving stop to his left at extra cover
short of a length at off stump, shapes to pull but that skids onto his thigh and floats up towards point
chipped to long-on's right. Another legcutter, full and up at leg stump. Leans into that one and places it nicely

taken at deep square! That is a sharp take from Sandakan! A big ground so he's halfway in from the line. This is a short of a length ball that's pulled firmly to Sandakan's right. He ambles and reaches out to high to his right to hold onto this
bouncer dug in too short. Let's that go over middle stump
full on leg stump, looks to flick and misses. Cops it on the front pad
googly at a length on off stump. Leans in and stabs to extra cover
just short of extra cover. Length ball pushed across off stump. Looks to drive and doesn't get to the pitch of that. Ends up slicing it
length on leg stump, gets deep in the crease and pushes to deep midwicket with soft hands
full on leg stump, flicked to deep midwicket
short of a length slider wide outside off. Slapped to long-off on the front foot
length outside off, gets forward and drives to long-off
full slower ball on leg stump. Allows that to land and tucks it to deep midwicket with soft hands
full and just outside off, chips it out to sweeper cover
blazed past point! Short and just outside off, jumps up to get behind that and crunches it aerially past the diving point's left hand
slower ball on a length at leg stump. Drops it into the square leg region with soft hands

looks plumb. And given. It did strike him in front of leg though, so they'll have a chat about it...and decided not to review. Full and sliding in at leg stump as he looks to drive. Rapped on the front leg with middle and off visible. Perhaps not plumb like it appeared at first, but just clipping leg stump..replays suggest it was missing! We've all got it wrong.
length and speared in at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
length on leg stump, jabbed towards mid-on off the front foot
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
length on off stump, opens up and chops to sweeper cover
pumps it over deep midwicket! Length ball pushed in fast at middle stump. It's sliding on nicely and he slogs through the line to clear the ropes
length ball just outside off, driven on the rise to long-off
full on leg stump, driven down to long-on
full on middle stump, driven to long-on's left. A tight second run but the throw from there is not ideal

he's dropped that onto the stumps but the bails have stayed on. The famous zing bails. Short of a length and cramped him with that. It slammed into his mid-riff and the ball dropped down onto the stumps as he swiveled
short and down leg side, beaten on the pull
legcutter dropped short and down leg side, pulled to fine leg
steers this over the fine leg boundary. Bouncer rising down leg side. He stays inside the line and shapes to hook, but there's minimal use of the wrists. It's more a ramp by the time he's done
full on middle stump, driven down to long-on
smoked wide of long-on! Length ball on off stump, sitting nicely up for the slog. He gets the front leg out of the way and slogs nonchalanty
full googly on leg stump. Leans in and clips through midwicket with soft hands
full and very wide outside off. Gets down for the paddle sweep but is beaten
length ball outside off, shuffles and looks to paddle that. Cops it on the pad outside off stump
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper
short of a length just outside off, stays leg side and chops it to sweeper to bring up his third consecutive fifty
full and wide outside off, driven to long-off
full on the stumps, tapped down the ground
slower ball at a length on off stump, dropped into the covers with soft hands
full on middle stump, driven to long-on
bouncer at a middle stump line. Let's that go
full outside off, leans in and drives to third man's left
slow dipping full toss on off stump. Watchfully tapped to extra cover
slower ball at a length on leg stump. Looks for the flick and deflects this in front of fine leg off the pad. Calls early for the second
length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full and into the pads. Stays tall and clips it down to fine leg
yorker at middle stump, jammed to midwicket
finished with a boundary! Attempted slower yorker it seems. Ends up as a leg-stump full toss. He holds his balance and caresses this to the long leg boundary
